news.title: Kimberly-Clark agrees to buy Tylenol owner Kenvue in $48.7 billion deal, creating consumer staples giant
news.summary: The combined company would bring together brands like Huggies and Kleenex with the likes of Band-Aid and Tylenol.

news.title: Nvidia shares up 2% in premarket as U.S. approves sales of its chips to the UAE
news.summary: Microsoft's licenses enable the firm to ship Nvidia chips — involving its more advanced GB300 GPUs — to the United Arab Emirates. Microsoft's licenses also allow the company to sell its software in the UAE.

news.title: Berkshire's operating earnings jump 34%, Buffett buys back no stock and raises cash hoard to $381 billion
news.summary: Berkshire's operating profit generated from the conglomerate's wholly owned businesses including insurance and railroads jumped 34% in the third quarter.

news.title: Treasury Secretary Bessent says SNAP food benefits could restart by Wednesday
news.summary: SNAP food benefits could restart as early as Wednesday, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says. SNAP benefits could resume as soon as Wednesday.

news.title: Auto giants rally as China says it will consider exemptions for Nexperia chip exports
news.summary: A standoff between the Netherlands and China over chipmaker Nexperia had prompted auto giants to warn of production outages. The standoff has now been resolved.

news.title: Here’s what’s worth streaming in November 2025 on Netflix, Hulu, HBO Max and more
news.summary: ‘Stranger Things’ kicks off its final season, ‘Pluribus’ is revealed on Apple, and ‘Landman’ returns to Paramount+.

news.title: Nike and Target named new CEOs. Why investors shot first and asked questions later.
news.summary: How to know when a CEO shakeup is a buy signal — and when it screams “sell.” How to tell if a company’s new CEO is a good or a bad sign.

news.title: My father’s estate was awarded $50K in a class-action lawsuit. My brother, as executor, kept the money. What can we do?
news.summary: “My brother retains the money awarded to my father to this day. My mom is still alive,” he says. “My dad is still here. He’s alive.”

news.title: Investors are buying into AI that can’t spell. Smart money is buying these stocks.
news.summary: AI fails at questions a 4-year-old can answer. Here’s where the real money is. AI fails at Questions a 4,000-strong crowd can answer, but it can do much more.

news.title: Earnings are supporting stocks, but there are two risks to watch, says Morgan Stanley
news.summary: Fed policy and funding markets may be a headwind, says Michael Wilson. Even as earnings growth comes in stronger than expected, he says.
